document_data.name: Smoky Quartz
document_data.mainbody:
{{Wikipedia article|smoky quartz}}
'''Smoky Quartz''', also known as '''cairngorm'''<ref group="note">In the revised version of Volo's Guide to All Things Magical, [[Elminster]] cautioned that what uninformed people called "cairngorm" was usually heat-treated glass and not this gemstone. See the footnote on page 50. or '''moorland topaz''', was a variety of [[wikipedia:en:quartz|quartz]] that was often found in massive deposits.
document_data.Description:
Smoky quartz ranged in color from brownish-yellow to brown to black and was usually [[wikipedia:en:Brilliant (diamond cut)|brilliant cut]] into faceted gems regularly used to decorate weapons. Morion was used in magical inks and as a necromantic spell component. A typical specimen had a base value of 50 gp.

Smoky quartz was considered sacred by followers of [[Mask]]—appropriate for sacrifice, or to be consecrated for use, or recognized as boons or omens when found.{{Cite web enhancement/Deity Do's and Don'ts|13}}
document_data.Powers: When bones were immersed in a solution that included morion they became hard as steel and immune to hostile necromantic effects. For example, a magic item made with morion-treated bone could not be affected by a rival necromancer who attempted to disrupt its magical function by targeting the bone material.
document_data.Cultural Significance:
Smoky quartz was a common stone among the drow, a gem worn by drow of average station, albeit they used only blue ones.

Smoky quartz was sacred to the dark [[Chult]]an demigod [[Eshowdow]].<ref>
